alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Northeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 1:22AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Johnson and eastern Big Horn Counties through 200 AM MDT... At 122 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cloud Peak, which is also 21 miles northeast of Ten Sleep, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Johnson and eastern Big Horn Counties, including the following locations... South Fork Campground, Buffalo Johnson County Airport and Johnson County Fairgrounds. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between mile markers 286 and 299. Interstate 90 between mile markers 52 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Northeast Johnson County
